result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek R. Harvey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea and Sentencing Hearing August 31, 2016

Defendant Derek R. Harvey in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Derek R. Harvey in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states agreements reached.  Court questions reimbursement of drug buy money.  State responds.  Atty Martinez responds.  Parties are in agreement.  DE is in agreement w/recommendations as read by the State and enters guilty pleas.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  Victim is present but does not wish to make a statement and hasn't provided a VIS.  State makes statement.  Court explains to the DE his right to a PSI.  DE waives his right to PSI and Atty Martinez is in agreement.  Atty Martinez makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  

16CF157
Cts 1-3, 5, 6:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 4:  Guilty
Probation for one year consecutive to sentence in 15CF193
Conditions of probation:
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment
Domestic Violence counseling and any other treatment/counseling per agent

15CF193
Ct 1:  Guilty
5 1/2 yrs prison (2 1/2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed
Conditions of extended supervision:
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment 
Any other treatment/counseling per agent
DE is eligible for CIP and SAP
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

15CF404 and 14CF81 are dismissed/read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Derek R. Harvey in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Derek R. Harvey in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
Return date on August 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Request warrant be stayed to allow defendant to appear.  State moves for a warrant.  Notices were sent to last known address, not returned. Defendant Derek R. Harvey in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez in 15CF404 there was a prelim set last week.  DE will now do waiver of prelim in that matter and proceed to arraignment today.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause in 15CF404.  15CF193, 15CF404 and 14CF81 will track.  Atty Martinez requests arraignment be set in 15CF404.  State notes information filed today in Court.  Court sets arraignment.  Bond continues in all three matters.  Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on April 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
